metadata.Title: CVE-2019-9075 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Binary File Descriptor (BFD) library (aka libbfd), as distributed in GNU Binutils 2.32. It is a heap-based buffer overflow in _bfd_archive_64_bit_slurp_armap in archive64.c.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9075` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

binutils - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-aarch64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-alpha-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabi - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-arm-linux-gnueabihf - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-common - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-for-build - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-for-host - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-hppa-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-hppa64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-i686-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-i686-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-i686-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-ia64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-m68k-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-multiarch - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-powerpc64le-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-riscv64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-s390x-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-sh4-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-source - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-sparc64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-kfreebsd-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnu - 2.34-5ubuntu1
binutils-x86-64-linux-gnux32 - 2.34-5ubuntu1
libbinutils - 2.34-5ubuntu1
libctf-nobfd0 - 2.34-5ubuntu1
libctf0 - 2.34-5ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: binutils package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.34-5ubuntu1').
